columns.name: drift_score
columns.comment: The drift score (between 0 and 1) is low (udner 0.1) if the new dataset and the original dataset are indistinguishable.

columns.name: fugacity
columns.comment:
Proportion of samples predicted (in %) in each decile when scoring on both the original test and the new input dataset.

Decile 0: from -inf to 84.84
Decile 1: from 84.844 to 128.42
Decile 2: from 128.424 to 172.0
Decile 3: from 172.003 to 215.58
Decile 4: from 215.582 to 259.16
Decile 5: from 259.161 to 302.74
Decile 6: from 302.74 to 346.32
Decile 7: from 346.319 to 389.9
Decile 8: from 389.899 to 433.48
Decile 9: from 433.48 to +inf

columns.name: fugacity_relative_change
columns.comment:
Relative change (in %) in each decile with respect to the original fugacity value.

Formula: 100*(new_fugacity - original_fugacity)/original_fugacity

Decile 0: from -inf to 84.84
Decile 1: from 84.844 to 128.42
Decile 2: from 128.424 to 172.0
Decile 3: from 172.003 to 215.58
Decile 4: from 215.582 to 259.16
Decile 5: from 259.161 to 302.74
Decile 6: from 302.74 to 346.32
Decile 7: from 346.319 to 389.9
Decile 8: from 389.899 to 433.48
Decile 9: from 433.48 to +inf

columns.name: most_drifted_features
columns.comment: When the drift score is medium/high (above 0.1), this is the list of features that have been drifted the most, with their % of importance (max 20 features).

columns.name: most_important_features_in_deployed_model
columns.comment: When the drift score is medium/high (above 0.1), this is the list of features that have been drifted the most, with their % of importance (max 20 features).

columns.name: riskiest_features
columns.comment:
If the drift score is medium/high (above 0.1), we recommend you to check those features.
A feature is considered risky if it is both in the top 40% of the most drifted features as well as the top 40% most important features in the original model.
